channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MA

item.title: Report E-2025070394
item.description:
Report E-2025070394

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-07-16
  • City: NORTHBOROUGH
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The forklift operator was unloading the pallet when he noticed a small spill under the pallet. It is believed that the loader punctured the bottom of the pail with the fork blades causing the spill. The unloader promptly notified leadership which put down absorbents to clean up the spilled material. The damaged pail was placed inside of an overpack container. The spill clean up materials were placed in an overpack container in preparation for disposition.

item.title: Report X-2025070137
item.description:
Report X-2025070137

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-07-01
  • City: WATERTOWN
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: ONE AIR PACKAGE WAS COLD TO THE TOUCH. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY TEN POUNDS OF DRY ICE COOLING ICE CREAM. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER GY04W6, THE UPS STORE, 675 VFW PKWY, CHESTNUT HILL MA 02467-3656.

item.title: Report E-2025070188
item.description:
Report E-2025070188

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-30
  • City: CANTON
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 30, 2025, five (5) 2.5-gallon cans of UN1203 had their lids come loose and released approximately three (3) gallons of product to the loading dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Green Site Services Group (GSSG) to remediate the site. GSSG personnel utilized hand tools and absorbents to remediate the UN1203-impacted loading dock floor. All impacted material was collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum and staged onsite.

item.title: Report E-2025070419
item.description:
Report E-2025070419

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-18
  • City: DRACUT
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO ENTERPRISE SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 09:06 ET, XPO notified the Call Center of a cargo release at terminal XNB. It was reported that approximately 2 gallons of Battery Acid released from two 2050-pound batteries due to falling over while in transit due to being improperly secured. The release impacted trailer #3216309 at dock #56. Call Center reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site, the terminal has requested contractor dispatch. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2-gallons of UN2794 Batteries, wet, filled with Acid to area of the wooden trailer floor due to improper loading. The crew neutralized the trailer floor with an acid eater. The damaged batteries were up righted and secured to a new pallet. The neutralized battery acid impacted absorbents were containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2025060375
item.description:
Report E-2025060375

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-17
  • City: NORTHBOROUGH
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The forklift operator punctured the drum unloading other freight while maneuvering in the trailer. The unintentional release of gasoline was immediately responded to by hazwoper trained personnel. The drum was tipped on its side to limit spillage, putty was applied to the drum to prevent further spillage. The drum was then placed in a yellow overpack container. Absorbent pads and socks were used to control and contain the spilled material. All of those materials were placed in a separate overpack container in preparation for disposition.
